item.title: #BringBackOurGirls Protesters To Secure Restraining Order Against Police
item.description: The #BringBackOurGirls protesters have declared on Tuesday, June 2, their intention to secure a restraining order against the police over a ban on their protests in Abuja. The protesters stated this via their twitter handle, quoting one of their leaders, Oby Ezekwesili: "We will go to court tomorrow to seek a restraining order against the police." The protesters decision follows public outrage and condemnations that have trailed the decision of the Nigeria Police Force to ban all protests in Abuja which demand freedom for the abducted Chibok schoolgirls.

item.title: Court Dissolves 8-Year-Old Marriage Over Sexual Starvation
item.description: The eight-year-old marriage between one David Omodiminiyi and his wife, Nike, was on Monday dissolved by an Ibadan Customary Court sitting at Mapo for alleged sexual starvation and loneliness claimed by the wife. *Divorce Decree Henry Agbaje, the presiding judge explained that it was mandatory to take the decision of ending the relationship due to the irreconcilable differences between the man and his wife, adding that efforts to make Nike not to quit the marriage through out of court settlement proved abortive.

item.title: Biafra: Why Deluded South-East Politicians Must Warn Corrupt Atiku
item.description: The Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) has warned the presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar, against using the agitation for Biafra for his political gain. Naija News reports that the pro-Biafra group was reacting to a statement credited to Atiku where he claimed that he would stop Biafra’s agitation if elected President in 2023.

item.title: CBN MPC Raises Interest Rate To 18.5%
item.description: Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) has increased its monetary policy interest rates to 18.5 per cent. Naija News understands that the decision was taken following a meeting by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the apex bank on Wednesday, May 24. The MPC voted to increase the benchmark interest rate by 50 basis points to 18 per cent. While reading the communique of the third MPC meeting of the year on Wednesday (today), CBN Governor, Godwin Emefiele, said the committee voted to keep the asymmetric corridor at +100 and -700 basis points around the MPR.

item.title: Vandalism, Others Push Oil Firms Bank Borrowing To N5.68tn
item.description: The debt of oil firms operating in the downstream and upstream subsectors of the Nigerian oil and gas industry increased from ₦5.19tn in January 2021 to ₦5.68tn in December 2021. It was gathered that operators in the oil sector borrowed ₦290bn from Nigerian banks in 2021 amid the significant rise in global crude oil prices. According to the data released by the Central Bank of Nigeria, the debt of companies in the oil and gas sector increased to ₦4.

item.title: Appraising CBN's Revised Cash Withdrawal Policy
item.description: The manner in which a critical section of the Nigerian establishment has railed against the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) justifies the wisdom of the framers of the country’s laws in entrenching the independence of CBN. According to Section 1(3) of CBN Act 2007, “the Bank shall be an independent body in the discharge of its functions.” How the House of Representatives intends to circumvent this provision by reportedly calling for the suspension of the new cash withdrawal policy being vigorously pursued by the central bank remains to be seen.

item.title: Ex-Presidential Candidate, Bashir Tofa Is Dead
item.description: Former Nigerian presidential candidate, Alhaji Bashir Othman Tofa has been reported dead. The Kano State-born politician was the presidential candidate of the defunct National Republican Convention (NRC), Naija News recalls. Tofa according to a report made available to newsmen at this time by a family source, died in the early hours of Monday after battling an undisclosed illness. “Alhaji Bashir tofa died after being admitted in hospital for sometime,” Daily Post quoted one of the deceased’s relations, Alhaji Muhammad, saying.

item.title: iOS 14 NFC Tag Readers Are Here So Users Can Now Access "App Clips"
item.description: App Clips in iOS 14 Are a Creative Solution to a Long-Standing Mobile ProblemBy Mustafa GatollariUpdated Sept. 17 2020, 11:39 a.m. ET Source: AppleBalancing operating system updates is a pretty tricky business. On the one hand, you've got long-term users who've managed to become familiar with the interface a particular software development team has created and they want to see it fleshed out more. Then there's the ever-changing landscape of technology that's advancing at an exponential rate.

item.title: Parents Face Tough Task As Schools Break For Holiday
item.description: The  festive season is here with us, majority of students have completed the Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education and Kenya Certificate of Primary Education while others are through with third term exams. Their presence at home brings that atmosphere of time to make merry is now. However, at some point early pregnancy and drug abuse are some of the hard tasks that parents always face. Third term alone, several cases of students indulging in drugs and allegedly in sexual activities, have hit headlines across the nation.

item.title: Who Is Quentin Tarantino's Wife? He and Daniella Pick Have Welcomed Their Second Child
item.description: Who is Quentin Tarantino's wife? The film director has been married to Israeli singer Daniella Pick for almost two years, and they are now parents. Source: Getty ImagesOther than Quentin Tarantino's undying passion for cinema and Brad Pitt, most outside his inner circle don't know much about his personal life. The 58-year-old cinematic mastermind generally stays out of the public eye — that is — until the Golden Globes roll around when he's basically guaranteed to make a long-winded speech.

item.title: Another Nigerian Shatters Guinness World Record
item.description: A student of Oyemekun Grammar School in Akure, Ondo State,  Philip Solomon has been declared the Guinness World Record holder for the most skips on one foot in 30 seconds. The 17-year-old on January 24, skipped 153 in 30 seconds on one foot to dethrone the former record holder Rasel Islam of Bangladesh whose record was 145. Solomon recorded a speed average of 5.1 skips per second. The Guinness World Record ratified his record on Tuesday, four months after his attempt.

item.title: It Is Hard For Women To Seduce Me - Victor Olaotan
item.description: Nollywood actor Victor Olaotan, who played the lead role in popular soap opera Tinsel for years before he quit, in a recent interview boasted that none of his former colleagues on the TV show were able to seduce him. Speaking with Nigeriafilms, Olaotan recalled an incident where a female fan approached him but he refused her advances, citing his self-control while a regular cast member on the TV series to emphasise his point.

item.title: James Gakara: Nakuru Doctor's Casket Placed Between Those of His Kids in Emotional Requiem Mass
item.description: James Gakara is said to have killed his two children before attempting to take his life, he later died while receiving treatmentDuring the mass, the deceased's relatives, who were still struggling to come to terms with the painful loss emotionally eulogised themThe three will be laid to rest at their family home in Mbaruk, Gilgil sub-county, on Tuesday, September 28A sombre mood engulfed the Holy Trinity Milimani Catholic Church in Nakuru as the family of James Gakara held a requiem mass for him and his two children.

item.title: Kitui: Mrembo ahama kubaini jamaa wake ni mganga
item.description: Kisanga kilizuka eneo la Kabati kaunti ya Kitui baada ya mrembo kufunganya virago na kutokomea mjini alipogundua mumewe ni mpiga ramli. Penyenye zinasema kidosho alighadhabishwa mno alipompata mumewe akiendeleza huduma za uganga katika sehemu hiyo ambapo alitambulika sana na wengi. Habari Nyingine: Mlipuko mwingine wa moto wazuka mji wa Berut nchini Lebano Semasema za mtaani zinaarifu kwamba kipusa alitoweka na maelfu ya hela ambazo jamaa alikuwa amehifadhi chini ya godoro jinsi Taifa Leo ilivyoripoti.

item.title: 'Atiku To Meet Wike On Wednesday'
item.description: The presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar is expected to meet with the Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike on Wednesday. The speculated meeting between the Atiku and Governor Wike is coming days after they meet in London to resolve their differences. A political actor close to Atiku who spoke with New Telegraph said Atiku is meeting with Wike to conclude his demands. The source noted that Atiku is hoping that the crisis in the party will be resolved ahead of the 2023 general elections.

item.title: 'Hold Davido Responsible If Anything Happens To Me'
item.description: Award-winning Nigerian singer, Tiwa Savage, has filed a petition against her colleague, Davido, over the alleged threat of assault and grievous bodily harm. Naija News understands that in the petition submitted to the Lagos Commissioner of Police, Adegoke Fayoade, the singer said Davido threatened to harm her. According to TheCable Lifestyle, she alleged that Davido made a “direct threat to my rights to life, privacy and dignity of my person”.

item.title: The Survivor 46 Cast Is on Instagram: Here's Who to Follow
item.description: What Are the ‘Survivor’ 46 Contestants’ Instagrams? We Have the DeetsYou're probably not friends with any of the 'Survivor' cast, but you can at least live through them via Instagram. By Brandon CharlesFeb. 28 2024, Published 6:21 p.m. ET Source: CBSGet ready, because Survivor is officially back! On Feb. 28, the long-standing reality competition series’ kicks off its newest season. Featuring 18 new contestants from diverse backgrounds competing in the Mamanuca Islands in Fiji, the show looks to continue its dominance as one of the highest rated network TV reality competition shows.

item.title: Ways of fighting political apathy in Nigeria
item.description: It is a position of a person or social group characterized by indifference to political life and sometimes can be considered as deviant behavior. The reasons of this phenomenon may be different: from belief in rigging of elections to distrust of the politicians. The political apathy is also widespread in Nigeria and it has a number of negative consequences. Find out ways of fighting political apathy below. Political apathy meaningPolitical apathy (in other words, absenteeism) means a phenomenon when citizens shirk a participation in elections, or in broad sense, political behavior characterized by inaction.

item.title: 'It Is Painful' - Ize-Iyamu Withdraws From Edo Governorship Race
item.description: All Progressives Congress (APC) Governorship aspirant, Osagie Ize-Iyamu, has withdrawn from the Edo State gubernatorial race, barely 24 hours to the party’s primary election. Naija News reports that Ize-Iyamu announced his withdrawal on Friday, in a statement made available to journalists in Benin, the State capital. The withdrawal notice was addressed to the national chairman of the party, Abdullahi Umar Ganduje, and copied to the Acting State Chairman of the party, Emperor Jarrett Tenebe.

item.title: 120 best get well soon messages and wishes for him to cheer him up
item.description: If someone you care about is ill, the best way to show them you care is via get well soon messages for him. Your boyfriend may need more attention when he is sick, so why don't you take care of him and show your true feelings toward him? Send him one of these lovely messages to make his recovery more pleasant and less stressful. TABLE OF CONTENTSBest get well soon messages for himBy sending an inspiring get well soon text message for him, you will not only show your boyfriend how much you care about him but also empower him to recover quickly.

item.title: 2023: 'We Do Not Want Another Sick President'
item.description: Arewa Consultative Forum (ACF) has expressed doubt about the medical condition of presidential hopeful, Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu. The northern group says it will be an unfortunate situation for Nigerians to again vote in another sick candidate as President of the nation. The 2023 general elections are just at the corner and the National Leader of the All Progressive Congress (APC), Tinubu had confirmed to President Muhammadu Buhari his desire to become his successor.

item.title: A1 Bentley - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Rapper and producer well known for his collaborations with Drake, Tyga and Big Sean. He is also known for his appearances on the VH1 reality show Love & Hip Hop Hollywood. Before Fame He grew up in Kansas City, Missouri and played college basketball for three years. Trivia He wrote and produced nearly half of Chris Brown's OHB mixtape, including the hit single "Grass Ain't Greener." Family Life He married singer Lyrica Anderson, they had a son in 2018.

item.title: 13 of the Best Gifts for True Crime Fans
item.description: What are the best gifts for fans of true crime? It’s a gorey, macabre genre that just happened to attract millions of fans. So we made a gift guide. Everyone loves true crime… or so it seems. And there are some who love it so much that it basically takes over their personality. But when it comes to giving for the holidays, we’re not exactly sure how to buy gifts for these true crime junkies.

item.title: A Cat Ate a Weed Cookie and Got Ridiculously, Hilariously High
item.description: She accidentally left a weed cookie where her cats could get it. One of them ate it and got what she describes as "violently high." Source: TwitterCarmine Deville is a model, burlesque producer, and cat mom. She's got two of them. They're black, they're adorable, and one of them, Carmilla, recently got very, very high after eating a weed cookie that Carmine accidentally left out for a minute in a place that her cats could reach.

item.title: What Was Carlos Pacheco's Cause of Death? Comics Artist Died at 60
item.description: Acclaimed Comics Artist Carlos Pacheco Passed Away — What Was His Cause of Death?By Callie (Carlos) CadornigaNov. 9 2022, Published 6:22 p.m. ET Source: RTVE Noticias/YouTubeIt's a dark day for fans of comics and graphic novels. On Nov. 9, 2022, it was confirmed that artist Carlos Pacheco passed away. He is best known for his work for Marvel Comics and DC Comics, as well as the 1998 comics run of Avengers Forever.

item.title: Airing Hate Speech Attracts N5m Fine NBC Warns Media Houses
item.description: Media houses have been warned by the National Broadcasting Commission to desist from airing hate speech which would henceforth attract a fine of #5 million. The development was revealed by the Zonal co-ordinator of the commission in charge of Kano, Jigawa, Kaduna and Katsina state, Abubakar Umar Kumo when he visited the Managing Directors of Jigawa broadcasting House in Dutse. Kumo during the visit said airing hate speech under the provision of the commission code attracts a minimum fine of five million Naira.

item.title: What Happened to R/Dankmemes on Reddit? Why They Went Private
item.description: Reddit's Popular Community r/DankMemes Went Private TodayBy Devan McGuinnessJun. 2 2020, Updated 10:04 p.m. ET Source: iStockOne of the most popular communities on Reddit, r/dankmemes, went private today, meaning you have to be approved by the site's moderators before you can view the page. The move was surprising to many, who wondered what happened since it's typically filled with super-shareable memes, and it's gone quiet – but for good reason.

item.title: Court Remands PDP Rivers Governorship Aspirant, Farah Dagogo
item.description: A governorship aspirant in Rivers State on the platform of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Hon. Farah Dagogo has been remanded in police custody. Dagogo, the lawmaker representing Degema/Bonny Federal Constituency in the House of Representatives, was arrested by police operatives in Rivers State on Thursday, Naija News recalls. He appeared before Chief Magistrate A.O Amadi-Nna of the Port Harcourt Chief Magistrate Court on Friday morning and was ordered to be remanded in Police custody.

item.title: David Gregory - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Famous for moderating the NBC program Meet the Press, he is also notable for his contributions to Imus in the Morning; Race for the White House (1600 Pennsylvania Avenue); and NBC Nightly News. A popular television personality, he had nearly two million Twitter followers by early 2015.  Before Fame While studying at American University in the late 1980s and early 1990s, he worked for the school's student TV station. In his late teen years, he also worked a summer job at the Tucson, Arizona-based station KGUN-TV.

item.title: Researchers Discover That Curiosity Is the Key to Staying Young Forever
item.description: If You Want to Stay Young Forever, Try Acting Like a CatBy Mustafa GatollariUpdated Aug. 28 2018, 12:03 p.m. ET Source: istock/distractifyResearchers have discovered that the key to staying young has just as much to do with keeping not just your body sharp but your mind as well. In layman's term: if you want to stay young, you've got to think young. Now before you think that means obsessing over any cute person who so much looks your way at the mall or thinking that your parents are ruining your lives, it actually has more to do with your desire to learn new things and constantly pushing yourself in that direction is what ultimately keeps you younger longer.

item.title: Wike, Fayose, Others Arrive Abia For PDP Campaign Flag-Off (Photos)
item.description: The Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike and his allies identified as the G-5 have arrived in Abia State to grace the flag-off of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) campaign in the state. Naija News had earlier reported that the G-5 would be at the event to honour the state Governor, Okezie Ikpeazu, who is one of them. The acting publicity secretary of PDP, Abraham Amah had disclosed that the governorship candidate of the party, Uche Ikonne, his running mate, Okey Igwe and other PDP candidates in the forthcoming election would be formally unveiled during the campaign.

Tinubu Mourns Namibian President, Hage Geingob
item.description: President Bola Tinubu has expressed sadness over the death of His Excellency, President Hage Geingob of Namibia. Naija News earlier reported that President Geingob died in the early hours of Sunday at the age of 82 following cancer treatment in the nation’s capital of Windhoek. In a statement on Sunday by his media aide, Ajuri Ngelale, President Tinubu mourned the painful loss of the veteran in the struggle for democracy, a proponent of good governance, and an advocate of economic, social, and political solidarity among African peoples.

item.title: Bradley Bell - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Television writer who won over five Daytime Emmy Awards and received widespread recognition as the lead writer and producer of the soap opera The Bold and the Beautiful. Before Fame He majored in television production at UCLA after studying at Latin School of Chicago, University of Colorado at Boulder, and University of Wisconsin at Madison. Trivia He served as a script writer for The Young and the Restless from 1984 to 1986.

item.title: Devery Jacobs - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Acclaimed actress most well recognized for her portrayal of Aila in the 2013 drama Rhymes for Young Ghouls. She has since gone on to star as Lollipop in Mohawk Girls and as Claudia Auditore in the Assassin's Creed: Lineage mini-series. Before Fame She earned one of her earliest film credits in a 2007 episode of Stephen King's Dead Zone. Trivia She wrote, directed, and produced the short film Stolen, a film documenting the life and loss of indigenous women in Canada.

Family Life She married Bodhi Elfman in February of 1995. The couple had a son named Story in 2007 and another son named Easton in 2010.

item.title: 'Davido Should Be Respectful, I'm Not His Fan'
item.description: Nollywood actress, Kate Henshaw, has expressed her lack of admiration for Nigerian singer, David Adeleke, popularly known as Davido. Naija News reports that the movie star, in an interview with media personality, Chude Jideonwu, said she is not a fan of Davido or likes him. When asked about her reason, Kate cited Davido’s failure to greet her during their encounter, leaving a feeling of disrespect. She also clarified that she had no personal issues with him and acknowledged his generosity, particularly his charitable acts, such as giving money donated on his birthday to orphanages.

item.title: 'My Mother Says I Must Get A Degree'

The singer stated via Twitter that his mother had insisted that he has to get a degree despite having a successful career. He went on to state that he has gotten admission into UNILAG in the Creative Arts department and would be resuming classes soon. item.title: Full Text Of The Speech By President Buhari At The Signing Of The Electoral Bill 2022 Into Law
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari on Friday, 25th February ended months of speculations and waiting when he signed the electoral act amendment bill 2022 into law. As earlier reported by Naija News, the signing was done at a brief ceremony that took place inside the Council Chambers of the Presidential Villa, Abuja at about 12:30 pm. The bill was signed after the review and subsequent transmission to the President by the National Assembly.

item.title: Gov't To Penalize People Who Remove Condom During Intercourse Without Permission
item.description: The act of removing condoms during sexual intercourse without the other partner’s consent has now become a punishable offence in California, United States of America. The government declared and signed into the law of the state on Thursday that, hence, people found guilty of ‘stealthing’ would be liable for general, special, and punitive damages. The word ‘stealthing’, Naija News understands is a slang term for the nonconsensual removal of a condom during sex.

item.title: Ladipo Johnson Emerges As 'Running Mate' To Kwankwaso
item.description: A lawyer, Ladipo Johnson has emerged as the running mate to the 2023 presidential candidate of the New Nigeria Peoples Party (NNPP), Rabiu Kwankwaso. Naija News however understands that Johnson, a lawyer, is in the position as a placeholder in order to meet the deadline set by the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC). item.description: Vice President Yemi Osinbajo has said President Muhammadu Buhari’s plan to lift 100 million Nigerians out of poverty in ten years wouldn’t be business as usual. Naija News reports that the VP said a common-sense strategy is required to deliver the results promised by the Buhari led government. The VP said the government and stakeholders must be very intentional about the objectives and how to achieve them. Prof. Osinbajo who spoke in Abuja on Friday at the inaugural meeting of the National Poverty Reduction with Growth Strategy Steering Committee held at the Presidential Villa said the government would adopt a different and more effective approach in actualizing the objective of eradicating poverty.

item.title: Rivers, S/South Historically PDP Enclave, Atiku Will Win There

During the inauguration of the central planning committee of the PDP Ward 2 Ward 2022 National Conference, Babangida said Rivers State and the entire South South is a historical PDP enclave. According to the former governor, stakeholders are working hard to ensure the PDP sustains past electoral successes.

item.title: Three Kidnappers Killed By Thunderstorm In Kwara
item.description: Three suspected kidnappers were reportedly killed by a thunderstorm in the agrarian Oro Ago community in the Ifelodun local government area of Kwara State last weekend. Reports obtained by Naija News asserted that the victims of the thunderstrike were suspected members of an eight-man kidnap gang, who reportedly operated in Iwo, in the Isin local government area of the state about three weeks ago. The state command of the Nigeria Police Force has since commenced an investigation on the incident following a viral video reportedly showing the decomposing bodies of three suspected criminals, presumably in their 20s, who are said to have burnt beyond recognition in a bush, with flies all over the scene.

Buhari's Excessive Borrowing Will Plunge Nigeria Into Bankruptcy
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Governors Forum has raised the alarm over the current debt profile of the country put at N36 Trillion incurred by the All Progressives Congress (APC)-led federal government. The forum expressed worry that the federal government was gradually plunging Nigeria into bankruptcy with it’s excessive borrowings on frivolous items, adding that over 80% of the normal Appropriation is being spent on debt servicing. In a communique issued on Monday after a meeting of the Forum in Uyo, Akwa Ibom state, the PDP governors said also accused the Nigeria National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) and other revenues generating agencies of the federal government of lack of transparency and accountability in the declaration of revenue proceeds.

item.title: Nigeria Loses N1.22tn To Deficit Oil Production OPEC
item.description: The Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) says Nigeria lost about 22.658 million barrels of crude oil valued at N1.22tn in the first quarter of 2022. Naija News reports that OPEC made this known in a series of data contained in various reports released in the last four months. The data released by OPEC showed that Nigeria failed to meet its oil production quotas in January, February and March 2022.

item.title: What Atiku Said After Receiving PDP Certificate Of Return
item.description: The Presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar, has charged all party members to unite and work together to win the 2023 presidential poll. Atiku made this known on Wednesday when he received the Certificate of Return at the party’s headquarters in Wadata Plaza, Abuja. The former Vice President applauded the party for conducting a free and fair presidential primary election and ensuring a hitch-free exercise. Atiku stated that the love and unity showed by the Governors of the party, his worthy co-aspirants, present and past leaders, stakeholders and party supporters give him an assurance of a better tomorrow.

item.description: A fresh crisis is threatening to hit the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) National Working Committee (NWC) over the decision to retract a ‘draft letter’ written to its presidential candidate, Bola Ahmed Tinubu. In the leaked letter, the APC National Chairman accused Tinubu of breaching the agreement he had with the NWC with regard to the composition of the presidential campaign council.

item.title: Who Hosts the Radio Show 'Swap Shop'? It Started on the Radio Before Arriving to Netflix

Fans of shows like Pawn Stars and American Pickers will love Netflix's Swap Shop, which is based on the Tennessee radio show World Famous Swap Shop. The radio show, which has been on air since 1957, coined its title in 1970. Now that Netflix has adapted the shop's story for the screen, fans are curious about the original radio show.

item.title: Influencer's Viral 'Surprise Proposal' Was Actually Pitched to Brands Months Ago
NASS Raises Costs For Presidential Candidates To N5bn
item.description: The National Assembly has raised election costs for presidential candidates from N1 billion to N5 billion. Naija News reports that the National Assembly made the provision in the revised Electoral Act Amendment Bill passed by the lawmakers last week. In the revised electoral bill which will be sent to Buhari for assent, presidential candidates have the chance to spend up to N5 billion as election expenses. Also, governorship candidates can now spend N1 billion as election costs against N200 million which was the former amount pegged by the National Assembly.

item.title: Olubadan, Ladoja, Others Hold Advisory Council Meeting
item.description: The Olubadan of Ibadanland, Oba Lekan Balogun, on Wednesday, held an Advisory Council meeting with the Otun Olubadan of Ibadanland, Rashidi Ladoja and others. Ladoja, who had shunned the meeting several times following the elevation of members of the advisory committee to beaded crown-wearing monarchs, was present. He arrived Alarere residence of Oba Balogun at about 11:48 a.m. for the meeting in his black Toyota Land Cruiser Jeep with the number plate BDJ 123 AS.

Farouk Lawan Sentenced To 7 Years In Prison
item.description: A former member of the House of Representatives, Farouk Lawan, has been jailed for seven years for demanding a bribe of $3million and receiving $500,000. Justice Angela Otaluka of the High Court of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), sitting at Apo, Abuja, on Tuesday, found the former lawmaker guilty in the three-count charge brought against him by the Independent Corrupt Practices and Other Related Offences Commission (ICPC) against him. Lawan, who was the chairman of House Adhoc Committee on Petroleum Subsidy Regime in 2012, was dragged to court by the Independent Corrupt Practices and Other Related Offences Commission (ICPC), on behalf of the Federal Government.

item.title: Tinubu, Southern Politicians Imposed Buhari On Nigerians
item.description: The Coalition of Northern Groups (CNG) says southern politicians led by the national leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Ahmed Tinubu, should be held responsible for the atrocities committed by the Muhammdu Buhari government. The group stated that Tinubu and some southern leaders imposed President Buhari on Nigerians and presented him as the only alternative to ex-President Goodluck Jonathan in 2015. In an interview with the Punch, CNG spokesman, Abdul-Azeez Suleiman, stated that the North only supported the idea following the devastation of the region by Boko Haram insurgents.

item.title: 'Let Me Rest' - Buhari's Spokesman, Garba Shehu Speaks On His Next Move
item.description: The Senior Special Assistant to former President Muhammadu Buhari on Media and Publicity, MalamGarba Shehu has said the first thing he wants is to rest after a long eight years of service. The former president’s spokesman said he, first of all, wants to go on vacation because he needs time to unwind and calm down, Naija News learnt. Shehu told Daily Trust in an interview that the vacation is paramount to him because there was no provision for annual vacation for personal staff.

item.title: Presidency Gives Update On Betta Edu's Investigation
item.description: The Presidency has made a firm declaration that President Bola Tinubu’s administration will maintain a no-tolerance stance towards any form of corruption, especially in the ongoing investigation of the Ministry of Humanitarian Affairs and Poverty Alleviation and its Social Investment Programmes. This commitment was articulated by the Special Adviser to the President on Media and Publicity, Ajuri Ngelale, during his appearance on TVC’s “Politics on Sunday.” Ngelale emphasized that the Tinubu administration has no ‘sacred cows’ and will not hesitate to take action against anyone found culpable in the investigation.

item.title: Rumer Willis - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Bruce Willis and Demi Moore's daughter, who became the winner of season 20 of Dancing with the Stars. She appeared in the films The House Bunny, Striptease and The Whole Nine Yards. In 2019, she had a stint on NBC's The Masked Singer. Before Fame She attended the Interlochen Arts Academy, Wildwood Secondary School, and the University of Southern California. Trivia She had a brief stint on 90210. Family Life She has two younger sisters, Scout and Tallulah.

item.title: Booker T. Washington - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Renowned African-American author and presidential advisor who served as the director of the Tuskegee Institute. Before Fame He attended college in Virginia before being named the head of the newly established Tuskegee Institute in Alabama. Trivia His 1901 autobiography, "Up From Slavery," made him famous, as did his 1895 Atlanta Address. Family Life He was born into slavery in Virginia, and his family relocated to West Virginia after slavery became illegal.

item.title: Court Sacks Cross River Lawmakers For Joining APC
item.description: Twenty members of the Cross River State House of Assembly have been sacked for dumping the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) for the All Progressive Congress (APC). Justice Taiwo Taiwo of the Federal High Court sitting in Abuja, sacked the lawmakers in a ruling on Monday, Naija News reports. The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) had filed a suit marked FHC/ABJ/CS/975/2021 against the lawmakers alongside Governor Ben Ayade over their defection to the All Progressives Congress (APC).

item.title: Post Malone Is a Father-to-Be and Musical Superstar, but What's His Net Worth?
item.description: Musical sensation Austin Post, better known as Post Malone, has performed in sold-out stadiums and even on 'SNL.' What is his net worth? Source: Getty ImagesMusical sensation Austin Post, better known by his stage name Post Malone, has been performing music since 2013. He rose to fame with his hit "White Iverson" and continued to climb Billboard charts, appear in commercials, and sell out stadiums. Now, Post is even going to be a father, so it seems like his future is pretty bright.

item.title: Skunky - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: First gained a following as a Vine video content creator with his short-form comedy videos attracting more than 100,000 followers before the app was shut down. He's earned over 200,000 followers to his officialskunky Instagram account. He has also started a clothing company called STUPID.  Before Fame With the encouragement of his brother-in-law, he posted his first Vine in April of 2015 titled "How Girls be acting when they get alot of followers!

item.title: You Are Glorifying Yourself For Massacring Igbos While Terrorists Occupy Your State
item.description: The Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) has accused the former Head of State, General Yakubu Gowon (retired) of carrying out a genocide. The group claimed that the former nation’s leader was responsible for leading the second bloodiest genocide after the Israeli Holocaust against the Igbos. Speaking via its spokesman, Emma Powerful, IPOB insisted that the current generation of Igbos would actualize Biafra independence. Powerful stated this on Sunday while reacting to Gowon’s latest comment on the Biafra civil war.

item.title: DISCLOSED: The 10 Highest Paid African Presidents 2015
item.description: It is well-known that Africa is a continent with a high potential and extremely rich natural resources. Can you imagine how rich African countries' leaders are? The Africa Review notes that only a few countries make public what they pay their leaders and in many African countries, the first thing leaders do when they come into power is to increase their pay. "In Egypt, for instance, the president's pay shot up from a paltry $280 per month, put in place by the austere Mohammed Morsy administration, to $5,900 per month just before General Abdel Fattah al-Sisi predictably won an election,"

item.title: Labour Threatens Strike Over Minimum Wage
item.description: The Trade Union Congress of Nigeria (TUC) has issued a stern warning about potential industrial action due to delays in establishing a committee to discuss the new minimum wage for public sector workers. The Federal Government’s inertia in naming its representatives to the committee has been a primary cause for concern, particularly as labour unions have declared their readiness to commence negotiations. This development comes amidst growing frustrations among workers grappling with the surging cost of living.

item.title: Priests unearth 2 magical pots at Mwingi's notorious blackspot where 10 students perished
item.description: - The cleansing ritual was performed by leaders from different churches in Kitui county - The pots were discovered after a series of prayers and fasting - The pots containing skulls of human heads are believed to be responsible for accidents at the spot - The ritual was performed weeks after 10 pupils lost their lives in a tragic accident at the said spot Church leaders from Kitui County on Monday, August 27, unearthed two pots at Mwingi's notorious blackspot believed to be causing frequent accidents at the scene.

item.title: Sam Houston - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: American politician who served as a U.S. Senator from Texas from 1846 to 1859 and was the 7th Governor of Texas from 1859 to 1861. He was credited with bringing Texas into the United States constituency. Before Fame Before moving to Texas, he served in the U.S. House of Representatives for Tennessee from 1823 to 1827 and was elected 6th Governor of Tennessee in 1827. Trivia He was removed from his post as governor when he refused to swear allegiance to the Confederacy during the American Civil War.

She worked as a social worker on skid row during the AIDS epidemic and with homeless people. Before Fame Her full name is Elizabeth Boyce. She is from New Haven, Connecticut. Trivia Her libboyce Instagram account has earned more than 440,000 followers. Family Life  She will always be the mother of Cameron Boyce. Her husband is Victor Boyce.

item.title: True-Crime Shows "Should Have a Social-Justice Reason for Being Made," Says Director Joe Berlinger (

Most people became familiar with his work through 1996's Paradise Lost: The Child Murders at Robin Hood Hills, which pushed the murders of three 8-year-old boys and the unfair imprisonment of three young men into the mainstream.

item.title: Who Dies in 'Euphoria' Season 2? Details Here (SPOILERS)
item.description: Who Dies in Season 2 of 'Euphoria?' Here's the Low-Down (SPOILERS)By Leila KozmaFeb. 28 2022, Updated 9:16 a.m. ET Source: HBO MaxSpoiler alert: This article contains spoilers for the Season 2 Finale of Euphoria. Familial ties are at the focal point of Season 2 of Euphoria. One storyline explores Nate Jacobs' (Jacob Elordi) conflicted relationship with his father, Cal (Eric Dane), while another addresses the immense grief Rue (Zendaya) has felt since her dad's passing.

item.title: Arise TV Fined N2m For Airing Fake News About Tinubu
item.description: The National Broadcasting Commission (NBC) has sanctioned Arise TV for airing fake reports about the presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC)  Bola Tinubu. The television station was fined N2 million for breaching the broadcasting code. Naija News reports that this development follows the petition written to the NBC by the APC. It was gathered that the Presidential Campaign Council of the All Progressives Congress (APC) has demanded a sanction on Arise News and Channels TV over the alleged fake news about the party’s presidential candidate, Bola Tinubu.

item.title: Ava Sambora - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actress who made her on-screen debut as Wendy in the 2012 Judd Apatow film This Is 40.  Before Fame She appeared early in her career in an episode of the television series Good Luck Charlie. Trivia She modeled for her father's fashion line, White Trash Beautiful, at a 2010 Los Angeles Fashion Weekend event. Family Life She is an only child. She was born to musician Richie Sambora and actress Heather Locklear.

item.title: Elaine Welteroth Has a Few Tricks up Her Sleeve After Her Exit From 'The Talk'
item.description: What is Elaine Welteroth doing now after leaving 'The Talk'? The Season 19 'Project Runway' judge opens up about what's next after her exit. Source: Getty ImagesMany recognize Elaine Welteroth as a judge on Project Runway or from her role on grown-ish in 2018. But the best-selling author was making moves in the media industry long before her television debut. Since securing a role as Teen Vogue’s editor-in-chief, Elaine has acquired a lengthy resume of hosting gigs, and she eventually became a permanent host on The Talk alongside Sharon Osbourne, Carrie Ann Inaba, and Sheryl Underwood.

item.title: 2023: You Don't Deserve PDP Ticket
item.description: Rivers State Governor and 2023 presidential hopeful, Nyesom Wike has submitted that some persons within the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) don’t deserve the party’s ticket. He stated without mentioning specific names that such persons abandoned the party back in 2015 when it lost the presidential pols while some others in the same category worked against the PDP to install President Muhammadu Buhari who was the candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC).

item.title: 2Face Pleads For A Don Jazzy, D'Banj Comeback
item.description: Talks of a possible comeback of contemporary Nigerian music’s fantastic duo Don Jazzy and D’Banj has been rife in recent months. The rumours about the possible comeback started following D’Banj’s interview a few months back with Olisa on The Truth, when he was asked who really broke up Mo’Hits. This was followed by Don Jazzy's shout out to D’Banj on the latter's birthday, then D’Banj dedicating his Evolution Award to Don Jazzy at the MTV Africa Music Awards (MAMAs) in South Africa.

item.title: Arms Deal Scandal: EFCC Trace N650m To Thisday Publisher
item.description: As part of the ongoing investigations into how the office of the National Security Adviser (NSA) shared funds meant for fighting Boko Haram, the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) investigators have detected another line of payment made to companies linked with Nduka Obaigbena, owner of Arise TV and Thisday publisher. According to Sahara Reporters, the investigators said Obaigbena received at least N650m from Dasuki for questionable transactions. EFCC sources alleged that Obaigbena, who is also the Chairman of the Newspaper Proprietors Association Of Nigeria (NPAN), has dropped out of sight since the discovery and all attempts at reaching him have proved abortive.

item.title: FMB DZ - Age, Family, Bio
Nigerian Pensioners Threaten To Protest Naked
item.description: The Nigeria Union of Pensioners has threatened to stage a naked protest if the welfare of pensioners in the country does not improve soon. Naija News reports that during a news briefing in Abuja on Friday, the National President of the union, Godwin Abumusi, announced that his union will take action to draw the world’s attention to pensioners’ plight. “I am going to lead Nigerian pensioners naked,” he declared, emphasizing that during protests, they will demonstrate naked on the streets to highlight the plight of pensioners in Nigeria, even if they face arrest for their actions.

item.title: The 'Fuller House' Series Finale Included a Triple Wedding and a Few Familiar Faces
item.description: How does 'Fuller House' end? The final season of the reboot of the hit comedy 'Full House' dropped on Netflix on June 2. How the Tanners said goodbye. Source: NetflixWith a family lesson taught every episode, a multitude of dad jokes, and lots of hairspray (mainly for star John Stamos), Full House was a quintessential feel-good show in the late '80s and early '90s. The comedy ended in 1995, but reruns made Full House accessible to new audiences.

item.title: UFC Latest News and Updates
item.description: Based in Las Vegas, the Ultimate Fighting Championship is an American mixed martial arts promotion company, which is owned and operated by Zuffa, LLC. The first UFC event was held on November 12, 1993, and featured kickboxers, karate experts, boxers, and even a sumo wrestler. In 1996, Senator John McCain led a campaign to ban UFC, calling it "human cockfighting." This led to 36 states banning "no-holds-barred" fighting. By the late 00s, UFC was on the brink of bankruptcy when casino executives Frank and Lorenzo Fertitta, along with business partner Dana White, purchased the UFC for $2 million.

item.title: What Did John Mayer Do to Taylor Swift? Here's the Tea

Throughout the course of her decades-long career, Taylor Swift has single-handedly sung the soundtrack to our love lives and for this, she must be protected at all costs. She’s been open about past heartbreak in her music — and her relationship with John Mayer is no exception. So, what did John do to Taylor, anyway?

item.title: Every Nigerian Deserve Equal Rights Peter Obi
item.description: Former governor of Anambra State and 2023 Presidential hopeful, Peter Obi, has said that every Nigerian deserves to be treated with fairness. The politician said this on Monday while inaugurating the Peter Obi Support Network, (POSN) National and Zonal Coordinators in Abuja, Naija News reports. According to him, Nigerians cannot continue to live in mutual suspicion. Obi noted that doing differently had denied the nation of having the best hands in governance.

item.title: APC Reacts As Tinubu Picks Shettima As Running Mate
item.description: The All Progressives Congress (APC) has reacted to the emergence of former Borno Governor, Kashim Shettima as the running mate to Asiwaju Bola Tinubu for the 2023 presidential election. The ruling party in a statement on Sunday described Shetima as a “truly competent, capable, reliable and able choice.” Naija News recalls Tinubu on Sunday, announced Shettima as his running mate for the 2023 presidential race. Explaining why he eventually opted for a Muslim-Muslim ticket, the APC presidential candidate defended his reason for not picking a Christian as his running mate.

item.title: Who Is Chelsea Day on 'Street Outlaws'? Here's What We Know
item.description: Chelsea Day is one of the many stars of 'Street Outlaws,' but what do we know about her outside of the show? Details on the racer. The hit Discovery racing show Street Outlaws Memphis has been a fan favorite ever since it first aired in 2013, and over the years the program has seen countless race car tinkerers and drivers join its ranks. As of late, one of the women who has taken center stage on the program has been Chelsea Day, an avid racer and proud mother whose prowess on the asphalt is enviable and whose love for her family knows no bounds.

item.title: 25 Artists Who Should Stick to Their Day Jobs
item.description: 25 "Artists" Who Should Stick To Their Day JobsBy Cristina ManasUpdated Oct. 11 2018, 3:05 p.m. ET Source: RedditOne of the hardest things for a burgeoning creative is learning to value their work. In this gig economy, there is no shortage of people looking to take advantage of eager talent willing to work for “experience,” and even those with years of work under their belt can sometimes feel unsure of themselves when negotiating rates.

item.title: Funke Akindele Moved To Tears Over What Her Estate Family Did For Her
item.description: Nollywood actress Funke Akindele almost broke down in tears after her estate family celebrated her in a beautiful way following her massive win at the 8th edition of the AMVCA. Funke Akindele who got nine nominations for the recent Africa Magic Viewers Choice Award went home with five awards. In the video shared on her Instagram page, some residents at Funke Akindele’s estate were seen jubilating, singing and praising the actress for her win.

item.title: How Ex-HoS, Oyo-Ita Allegedly Laundered Funds While In Service
item.description: A witness of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC), Hamma-Adama Bello, testified in a Federal High Court in Abuja, elucidating how the former Head of Service, Winifred Oyo-Ita, allegedly employed her companies to launder government funds during her tenure. The testimony outlined the purported involvement of Oyo-Ita’s companies in the illicit financial activities. Taking the stand before Justice James Omotosho, Bello, who holds the position of Chief Superintendent at the EFCC and heads its Special Investigation Team (SIT), served as the eighth prosecution witness (PW8) in the case.

She and Caitlin began performing in restaurants, coffee shops and festivals soon after and they began recording covers for their YouTube channel in 2015.

item.description: A Federal High Court sitting in Yola, Adamawa state capital presided over by Justice Abdulaziz Anka has on Wednesday reserved a date for judgement in the case filed by Nuhu Ribadu against the All Progressives Congress (APC) governorship Candidate, Senator Aishatu Dahiru Ahmed Binani. Ribadu lost the APC governorship ticket to Binani in a one-sided contest during the party’s primary election held on the 27th May, 2022 in Yola, Naija News recalls.

item.title: Final List Of 3 Contenders Emerge For PDP National Chairmanship Position (Full List)
item.description: Three candidates have emerged from those contesting to become the next National Chairman of the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). A candidate emerged each from the North Central, North West, and North-East geo-political zones. Naija News understands former Katsina State Governor, Ibrahim Shema defeated other aspirants to emerge from the North West, Senator Suleiman Nazif from Bauchi State, who is the current PDP Deputy National Chairman (North), emerged as the sole candidate from the North East and the North Central chose former Senate President, Iyorchia Ayu from Benue State.

item.title: William Gallas Warns Arsenal's Mikel Arteta To Avoid Victor Osimhen
item.description: Former Arsenal and Chelsea defender, William Gallas, has warned coach Mikel Arteta to avoid signing Nigerian striker, Victor Osimhen. There have been speculations that Mikel Arteta is making efforts to bring Victor Osimhen to the Emirates Stadium next summer. Recall that Osimhen is available for sale in the coming summer transfer window for a transfer fee worth between €120 million and €130 million. Arsenal are competing with Chelsea and Paris Saint Germain for the signature of the 25-year-old striker, who still has a contract with Napoli until 2026.

item.description: Korean pop singer and member of the K-pop boy band SF9 (aka Sensational Feeling 9), which was formed by FNC Entertainment. He and the band made their debut with the single "Feeling Sensation," which ranked at number eight on the Geon Music Charts. Before Fame He landed a spot on SF9, which was formerly known as NEOZ Dance after appearing in the Mnet competition series Dance or Band in 2016.

item.title: Luis Miguel: wife, family, parents, net worth, nationality
item.description: Luis Miguel is an international superstar whose name is synonymous with fame, riches and prosperity. He is also one of the few musicians who started their career at a young age and enjoyed immense success even in adulthood. However, his life has not been without setbacks which makes his biography that much more impressive. Following a dispute with his former manager, he was arrested in 2017. Apart from legal issues, he has also had to overcome personal struggles involving his mother and health issues.

item.title: University of Ibadan courses, cut off mark and requirements in 2024/2025
item.description: The University of Ibadan, commonly abbreviated UI, is a public research university in Nigeria. It was founded in 1948 as part of the constituent colleges of the University of London and began operating as an independent institution in 1963. Since then, UI has played a significant role in Nigeria's economic, cultural, political, and industrial growth. Learn more about the various University of Ibadan courses and their respective requirements. TABLE OF CONTENTSStudents can gain admission through direct entry or through the conventional UMTE way.

item.title: Who Was Nichelle Nichols's Husband? What to Know
item.description: Nichelle Nichols Was Married to Two Men Over the Course of Her 89-Year LifeBy Joseph AllenAug. 1 2022, Published 10:07 a.m. ET Source: Getty ImagesFew actors had a greater impact on the trajectory of TV history than Nichelle Nichols, whose time playing Uhura on Star Trek was groundbreaking. Following news of her death at the age of 89, tributes began pouring in for the late actress. Naturally, many also wanted to know more details about her personal life, including who she was married to.

item.title: 'Atiku Optimistic Of Settling Rift With Wike, Ortom, Makinde, Others'
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Presidential Campaign Organisation has said its presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar, will soon settle his rift with the five aggrieved governors of the party. Naija News reports that the five aggrieved Governors are Nyesom Wike (Rivers), Seyi Makinde (Oyo), Samuel Ortom (Benue), Okezie Ikpeazu (Abia) and Ifeanyi Ugwuanyi (Enugu). Speaking to journalists, the Director of Strategic Communications of the Atiku/Okowa campaign, Chief Dele Momodu described the prospects of reconciliation as very bright.

item.title: Femi Adesina Predicts More Confusion In PDP Before 2023
item.description: The Special Adviser to President Muhammadu Buhari on Media and Publicity, Femi Adesina, has predicted that the People Democratic Party (PDP) will be hit by more confusion ahead of the 2023 election. Speaking in an interview with Channels Television, Adesina stated that more members of the opposition party will defect to the ruling party. He also slammed PDP governors for accusing Buhari of turning the presidential villa to a secretariat of the APC.

item.title: We Promise Nigerians Tinubu Will Offer Abacha Kind Of Leadership Shettima
item.description: The vice-presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Kashim Shettima has said that his principal, Bola Ahmed Tinubu, will extend the same hospitality Nigerians enjoyed during the time of former military dictator, Sani Abacha. Naija News reports that Sani Abacha was a Nigerian general who ruled as the military head of state of Nigeria from 1993 until his death in 1998. He seized power on 17 November 1993 in the last successful coup d’etat in the military history of Nigeria.

item.title: Why Does Bobby Portis Wear Glasses? Fans Want to Know
item.description: Why does Bobby Portis wear glasses? After Game 2 of the Bucks first-round playoff series, the power forward returned and donned protective glasses. Since the beginning of May, the Milwaukee Bucks have been intensely battling it out with the Boston Celtics in the Eastern Conference semifinals. The Bucks are leading the series 3-2, with Game 6 taking place at Fiserv Forum on Friday, May 13. With the Bucks having the home-court advantage, will they secure the win and move on to face the Miami Heat in the Eastern Conference finals?

item.title: After Maurizio Guccis Murder, His Daughters Eventually Cut Off Their Mother
item.description: What happened to Maurizio Gucci’s daughters? As the family history gets rehashed in ‘House of Gucci,’ get updates on Alessandra and Allegra Gucci. Source: APPatrizia Reggiani's mugshot The new film House of Gucci recounts a traumatic time in the Gucci family history, culminating in the 1995 murder of fashion heir Maurizio Gucci and the conviction of his ex-wife, Patrizia Reggiani, on charges of orchestrating the killing. As the film depicts, the crime affected a younger Gucci generation, too.

item.title: Kenya Investment Authority functions and contacts
item.description: In these harsh economic times, it is crucial that people seek out alternative sources of income in the form of investments in Kenya. Presently, there are plenty of investment opportunities in Kenya that pay more than the minimum wage that some internships offer. That is precisely why the government started out the Kenya Investment Authority for people who are in need of starting a business in Kenya. The Kenya Investment Authority was established to help investors in Kenya.

item.title: Naira Devaluation Not Based On Parallel Market Rate
item.description: The Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) has said the devaluation of the Naira does not depend on the parallel market rate. Nigeria’s apex bank Governor, Godwin Emefiele, made the submission on Thursday while speaking at the end of the last 2020 Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting, in Abuja. Emefiele warned analysts using parallel market rates to force the apex bank to devalue the Naira to desist from such action, adding that the parallel market is only about five percent of the foreign exchange market.

item.title: Peter Obi-Datti Campaign Speaks On 'Deal With PDP's Atiku
item.description: The media office of the Obi-Datti 2023 Presidential campaign has reacted to reports claiming that the presidential candidate of the Labour Party, Peter Obi, has struck a ‘political deal’ to back the candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar. Naija News understands that reports emerged claiming that Obi had struck a deal to back the 2023 presidential ambition of the former Vice President. But reacting in a statement on Saturday, Peter Obi’s campaign office claimed that the speculations are the handiwork of charitable propagandists who indulge in distorting facts in the pursuit of imaginary relevance for their paymasters.

item.title: Again Gunmen Attack Anambra Community, Kill Four
item.description: Again, some yet to be identified gunmen have killed four people in Anambra State. Naija News understands that the victims were killed on Monday morning at different locations in the state. Two of the victims were identified as siblings. Their names are revealed as Godwin Ikechukwu Modobi and Nnajiofor Modobi. They were reportedly murdered in Umuhu village in Ukpor, Nnewi South Local Government Area of the state. A source close to the family told the PUNCH that Godwin was a direct younger brother to Nnajiofor, and was also a former youth leader in the community.

item.title: Chris Guest - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: British painter who specializes in oil. He is most recognized for his oil portraits of celebrities, iconic social figures, and alternative models. He shares a range of his stylized oil paintings to his self titled website and Instagram where he has over 200,000 followers.  Before Fame He first began sharing his artworks to his website in 2014. Beginning with a fine art approach to portraits through oil, his style transitioned to more freestyle brushstrokes and abstract elements in 2016 and 2017.

item.title: DSS Speaks On Recruitment Of New Operatives
item.description: The Department of State Services (DSS) on Tuesday dismissed reports that it has commenced the recruitment of new operatives. In a statement issued by its spokesperson, Peter Afunanya, the secret police warned jobseekers to be wary of fraudsters. According to the DSS, its recruitments are only done on merit and transparency and not on monetary basis. The service asked the general public to report any attempts by fraudsters to dupe them of their money.

item.title: FG Gives Update On Ending ASUU Strike, Insists Striking Lecturers Are Unreasonable
item.description: The federal government has described the lingering strike by members of the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) as unreasonable. The government position was made known on Monday by the Director of Press and Public Relations, in the Federal Ministry of Education, Bem Goong. He argued that eighty percent of what ASUU demanded from the government have been given to them so, in fairness, the union should have called off the strike.

item.title: Open Grazing Ban: There's No Wisdom In What You Said
item.description: The Ondo State Governor and Chairman of the South West Governors Forum, Rotimi Akeredolu has hit hard at his Kaduna State counterpart, Nasir El-Rufai over his position on the move against the open grazing of animals. While maintaining that the anti-open grazing law has come to stay in the south, Akeredolu lambasted Governor El-Rufai saying no sane leader should adopt the view of the Kaduna State governor. Naija News recalls El-Rufai on Tuesday said the open grazing ban policy adopted by the southern governors is not only unrealistic but also financially reckless.

item.title: 'House of the Dragon' Has Already Been Renewed for at Least One More Season
item.description: How many seasons will 'House of the Dragon' have? The original series spanned eight seasons, but 'House of the Dragon' might not be as long. Source: HBOFor the next 10 weeks, our vocabulary consists of two words — fire and blood. The highly-anticipated series House of the Dragon is finally here, and we couldn't be more excited to immerse ourselves in the world of House Targaryen. Better yet, we can't wait to see the Dance of the Dragons in live-action!

item.title: Aisha Buhari Boards Kaduna-Abuja Train (Photos)
item.description: The First Lady of Nigeria, Aisha Buhari on Thursday was spotted on the Abuja-Kaduna train. Recall that the first lady visited Kano State where he charged the Governor of the state, Abdullahi Ganduje, to ensure justice for five-year-old, Hanifa Abubakar who was kidnapped and murdered by her teacher. The media team of the first lady had first shared a video of her boarding a flight from Kano to Kaduna, after which pictures of her trip to Abuja by train were released.

item.title: Boko Haram Gets Over N11bn From Al-Qaeda, Al-Shabaab, Other Sources
item.description: The Islamist group Jama’atu Ahliss-Sunnah Lidda’awati Wal Jihad, popularly known as Boko Haram, may have received over $70million (N11.2billion) between 2006 and 2011 from its sponsors to conduct terrorist attacks, kidnappings, the most recent of which is abduction of over 234 schoolgirls from GGSS Chibok. This sum has been revealed by a retired Major of the U.S. Army, Chris Moghalu. The former military man and Intelligence Specialist made the disclosure on the African Independent Television (AIT) morning magazine programme, FOCUS NIGERIA, hosted by Gbenga Aruleba.

item.title: Lai Mohammed Slams PDP, Says Buhari Government Has Lots To Campaign With
item.description: The Minister of Information and Culture, Lai Mohammed has slammed the main opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) over the mockery of President Muhammadu Buhari’s administration. Naija News reports that the minister, who faulted the PDP’s comment that the APC can’t campaign with President Buhari’s achievements said the Naira exchange rate and inflation were insufficient indices to write off Buhari’s performance. According to him, it is a cruel irony that the main opposition party, who couldn’t complete a single modern rail line, can describe the Buhari government as a failure.

item.title: Man Beats His Wife To Death In Niger State Over Pap
item.description: Niger State Command of the Nigeria Police Force has apprehended a young man for allegedly torturing his wife to death. Reports reaching Naija News at this time alleged that Lawali Danladi who is in his 20, killed his wife, Zulai while they were both arguing over a pap she made for him. The incident reportedly happened at their home in Kadaura, a village in Yakila Gunna district of Rafi Local Government.

item.title: Company Income Tax Rises By 53 Percent In Q1 2022
item.description: TheNational Bureau of Statistics, NBS, said it recorded over 53 percent growth in the 2022 first quarter report on Company Income Tax compared to last year’s figures. It said about N532.48 billion in the Company Income Tax, CIT, was realized in first quarter of 2022 (Q1’22) compared to N347.8 billion in Q1’21. NBS noted this in its CIT report for Q4’21 released today, where it showed the top three largest shares in Q1’22 were Manufacturing with 21.

item.title: Bandits Kill One, Kidnap Many In Sokoto Community
item.description: Suspected armed bandits have killed one person and kidnapped several others during an attack on Tangaza town in Tangaza Local Government Area of Sokoto State. According to some residents, the bandits, who invaded the town on Friday after the evening prayer, started shooting sporadically. The residents stated that the bandits killed a trader on the spot and another young girl died after being taken to the hospital. Three other persons were said to have sustained injuries and were currently receiving treatment in a hospital.

You've probably noticed plenty of promoters churning out impressive live performances as of late, and that trend doesn't seem like it's going to go away any time soon.

item.title: EPL: Drop Ronaldo For Cavani In Man United's First XI
item.description: Former Arsenal player, Paul Merson has suggested that Portugal star, Cristiano Ronaldo should be dropped from Manchester United’s first eleven. According to Merson, Uruguayan professional footballer, Edinson Cavani would be better than Ronaldo playing alongside the likes of Jadon Sancho, Marcus Rashford, and Mason Greenwood in Man United’s attack line. The former Gunners urged Manchester United interim manager, Ralf Rangnick, to drop the Ballon d’Or winner from his squad, Naija News reports.

We Will Be Telling Nigerians Only The Truth About President Tinubu's Government
item.description: The Minister of Information and National Orientation, Mohammed Idris Malagi has promised Nigerians that his duty, as mandated by President Bola Tinubu is to tell the citizens the truth about the government and its policies. The Minister said under his watch, there will be no room for lies or fake news about government activities and policies, promising to operate an open door policy. Naija News reports Magagi stated this on Monday during an official reception, organized in his honour by the ministry on Monday in Abuja.

item.title: ABUJA BOMB BLAST: Pastor, Wife Narrowly Escaped Death In The Explosion
item.description: Pastor Avanti Jonas and his wife, Alice of Hephzibah church located in Kado area of Abuja have every reason to be thankful as they narrowly escaped death by the whiskers in the Abuja bomb blast which occurred yesterday, and which left 21 people dead and 17 injured, according to the police. Pastor Avanti Jonas and his wife - Scene of the blast According to National Enquirer the Pastor and his wife who got married last year, 2013 had gone to the Emab Plaza where the blast occurred before it escalated and spread to Banex to buy some few items.

item.title: Court Grants Abba Kyari Bail
item.description: A federal high court sitting in Abuja and presided over by Justice James Omotosho has granted bail to the suspended former head of the Intelligence Response Team (IRT) of the Inspector General of Police, Abba Kyari. The embattled Kyari was granted bail on Thursday after about 18 months in prison custody. According to the Judge, Kyari and his team refused to escape when they had the chance to do so during the Kuje Prison attack on July 5, 2022.

item.description: DJ Boof left the 'The Wendy Williams Show' in late 2020. But an Instagram post proves that DJ Boof and Wendy's months-long beef has ended. Source: Getty ImagesMost fans of The Wendy Williams Show know that the host and namesake of the daytime talk show is no stranger to stirring up drama and controversy. Wendy Williams was a staple of tabloids and press long before her ex-husband, Kevin Hunter, had an affair and child with his mistress and broke the internet.

item.title: What Happened to J. Crew? First Retailer to File for Bankruptcy
2023: Why Power Should Shift To The South
item.description: The Northern Governors have been condemned by chieftains of the All Progressives Congress in Ebonyi State over power shift to the south in 2023. The APC chieftains on Sunday said the governors from the north have no justification for not supporting a presidential candidate from the south in 2023. The Coordinator of APC Youth League in the South-East, Okenwa Uka in an interview with Punch, said though a rotational presidency is not constitutional, it is, however, an issue of conscience.

item.title: Actor Zachary Levi Has Come Under Fire for Amplifying Vaccine Misinformation
item.description: Zachary Levi is facing backlash after posting that he agrees that Pfizer is a dangerous company, leading some to wonder if he's anti-vax. Source: Getty ImagesIn spite of the fact that COVID-19 vaccines are safe and effective, there have been rumblings online since the vaccines were first released that they were somehow a danger to your health. Now, Shazam actor Zachary Levi is being accused of fueling those fires after posting a remark about Pfizer that has led to massive blowback from across the internet.

item.title: Criminals Taking Advantage Of Our Respect For Human Rights
item.description: The Minister of Justice and Attorney General of the Federation, Abubakar Malami, has said the federal government has been magnanimous in respecting the rule of law and enforcing fundamental human rights. During an interview on Nigerian Television Authority (NTA) programme on Tuesday, Malami accused some people are taking advantage of the federal government’s respect for human rights and rule of law to commit insurgency. Malami warned that the Buhari administration will not sit back and watch those persons take up arms to render the government “helpless”.

item.title: PDP Rejects Senate's Adoption Of Direct Primary For Party Elections
item.description: The opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has rejected the adoption of the direct primary for picking candidates for elections in political parties. Naija News reports that the National Publicity Secretary of the opposition party, Kola Ologbondiyan, stated this in a statement on Tuesday. This news medium had reported that the Senate on Tuesday approved that all political parties must use the direct primary for the election of candidates. But according to the PDP, the Senate decision to adopt direct primary is a hindrance to the development of democratic norms, and a plot to introduce anarchy in parties.

item.title: Sam Allardyce Identifies Eric Dier, As A Better Player Than Sergio Busquets
item.description: Sam Allardyce has identified Tottenham Hotspur’s player, Eric Dier, as a better player than Sergio Busquets, following England’s 3-2 win over Spain on Monday night in the UEFA Nations League match. Goals from Raheem Sterling and Marcus Rashford in the first half sealed the victory for the Three Lions side as second half goals from Paco Alcacer and Sergio Ramos were not enough to gain a point from the match that was played at the Benito Villamarin Stadium in Sevilla.

item.title: Angry Nigerians Dig Up Post Of Yul Edochie Admitting His Wife Married Him When He Was Jobless
item.description: Angry Nigerians have dug up an old post of Nollywood actor Yul Edochie admitting that his first wife married him when he did not have a tangible source of income. Recall that Naija News earlier reported that Yul Edochie took to social media to confirm the rumors of cheating on his wife, after showing off his new family with Judy Austin. Naija News reports that this comes days after a popular blog called him out about his new family, asking him to own up.

item.title: Gabrielle Giffords - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Democratic member of House of Representatives from Arizona who served her state from 2001 to 2012. She survived a nearly fatal gunshot wound to the head on January 8, 2011. When she handed in her resignation so that she could focus on her recovery she received a standing ovation from the entire House. Before Fame She attended Scripps College and Cornell University where she studied Mexican American relations. Trivia She is the second cousin of actress Gwyneth Paltrow.

item.description: Duane Lee Chapman, II, is famous because of his celebrity father and active role in his father's A&E Network reality show, Dog the Bounty Hunter. He is the first son of Dog the Bounty Hunter and his ex-wife, La Fonda Sue Honeycutt. What do you know about Duane Lee Chapman, Jr.? Since quitting Dog the Bounty Hunter, Duane Lee Jr. has maintained a low profile. Not much has been heard from him.

item.description: Is 'The Drop' Star Anna Konkle Married? She Tackles Motherhood in Latest Hulu FilmBy Katherine StinsonJan. 13 2023, Published 4:30 p.m. ET Source: Hulu The latest Hulu comedy film The Drop takes the title quite literally when Anna Konkle's character, Lex, drops her friend's baby on a tropical vacation getaway. Naturally, her friends are just a tad bit skeptical when Lex then declares that she, too, wants to be a mother after she dropped a literal baby.

item.title: Sultan of Sokoto Sends Powerful Message To Resident Doctors, FG
item.description: The Sultan of Sokoto, Alhaji Sa’ad Abubakar, on Saturday urged resident doctors in the country to suspend their industrial strike. According to him, doing so would prevent needless deaths considering the devastating effects of COVID-19 pandemic and the outbreak of cholera in some parts of the country. This was contained in a statement issued by NSCIA’s Director of Administration, Mr Zubairu Usman-Ugwu, in Abuja. The Sultan of Sokoto stated that the apex Islamic body in the country was worried and concerned about the strike, which he said, had increased the burden of vulnerable Nigerians.

item.title: This Sweet Dog Gets So Worried When His Owner Takes a Shower He Brings a Comfort Toy
item.description: This Sweet Dog Gets So Worried When His Owner Takes a Shower He Brings a Comfort ToyBy Aimee LutkinUpdated Nov. 18 2019, 2:18 p.m. ET Source: TwitterAnimals don't really understand our habits, but they're generally supportive. Especially dogs, unless you're riding something with wheels. A lot of them hate that. But one thing some pets don't get is our desire to clean ourselves all over with disgusting water. So gross.

item.title: Anna McNulty - ge, Famille, Biographie
item.description: À propos Contorsionniste, elle est devenue rapidement célèbre en publiant des photos et des vidéos de sa souplesse unique sur Instagram. Elle a accumulé plus d'1.1 million de followers depuis qu'elle a commencé à publier des photos en janvier 2015. Elle est aussi très populaire sur TikTok, où elle a plus de 8 millions de followers. Avant la gloire Elle est devenue cheerleader à 10 ans, et fut remarqué pour sa souplesse.

item.title: Buhari Warns EFCC Operatives Against Joining Partisan Politics
item.description: In a statement on Friday by presidential spokesman, Femi Adesina, the President advised the leaders and agents of the anti-graft agency to avoid being used for partisan politics or dragged into personal disputes. The President pointed out that the duty of the operatives is to serve the nation in its efforts to entrench good governance. Buhari gave the advice at the unveiling of the EFCC’s standard operating procedures, policies and manuals, held at the Presidential Villa in Abuja on Friday.

item.description: Award-winning adult and children's novelist known for his best-selling book Escape from Mr. Lemoncello's Library, which was optioned by Nickelodeon to become a TV movie. He also served as the president of the Mystery Writers of America's New York Chapter.

item.title: BBNaija Star Tacha Robbed In Paris (Video)
item.description: Big Brother Naija Star, Anita Natacha Akide, better known as Tacha, was on Monday robbed in Paris, France. In a post shared on her Twitter page, she disclosed that the robbers made away with valuables. According to the reality star, her two luggages which contained her clothes, wigs and money and laptop were stolen. Sharing a video of the incident, the reality star noted that she’s unhappy that she was robbed, adding that it was not fair to arrive in the country with three luggages and just have one to herself.

item.title: Bill Gate's wife visits Nasir El-Rufai in Kaduna
item.description: Melinda, wife of one of the world’s top richest men and philanthropist, Bill Gates, is currently in Kaduna meeting with the state governor, Nasir El-Rufai, Legit.ng has learnt. Melinda, a co-founder of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, an organisation which is into charity reportedly met with the governor and his economic team. READ ALSO: Suspected Fulani hersdmen attack southern Kaduna again, kill 3 Mrs. Gates, whose plane landed at the Kaduna Airport, governor that the Gates Foundation, also lauded Kaduna State’s drive to improve the range and credibility of data collection.

item.title: Rafa Nadal Advocates For Mbappe At Madrid As Arteta Dreams Of Bringing Him To Arsenal
item.description: Spanish tennis icon, Rafa Nadal believes that Paris Saint Germain forward, Kylian Mbappe will make Real Madrid a better team. Hence, the 37-year-old tennis icon has urged the Spanish La Liga giants to sign Mbappe during the forthcoming summer transfer window. Naija News has reported that Kylian Mbappe has told PSG that he plans to leave the club as a free agent next summer. This is seen as a big boost for Real Madrid who have been making efforts to sign the 25-year-old striker.

item.title: Why We Have Decided To Set Up Vigilantes In 36 States, FCT
item.description: The National President of Miyetti Allah Kautal Hore, Abdullahi Bello Bodejo has opened up on the reason the group is setting up vigilantes in the 36 states. According to Bodejo, the outfit is being set up to secure the safety of farmers and herders in the bush. Speaking during an interview with The Sun, the Miyetti Allah leader explained that the nomadic vigilantes will help in calming down the issues between herders and farmers.

item.title: Mbaka's 'Peter Obi Is Stingy' Scandal
item.description: Recall that after Fr Mbaka called out Labor Party flag bearer Peter Obi for being stingy, the Bishop of Enugu Catholic Diocese, Most Rev. Callistus Onaga ordered Catholic Faithfuls to shun Mbaka’s Adoration ministry. This led to a protest on the Adoration Ministries ground against Bishop Onaga. Speaking through his representative in Nigeria, Papal Nuncio, Antonio Guido Filipazzi, during the installation of Most Rev. Lucius Ugorji as the new Metropolitan Archbishop of Owerri Ecclesiastical Province in Owerri, the Imo state capital, the Pope condemned the protest on Adoration ground against Bishop Onaga.

item.title: Plane Crash: I Lost A Political Successor Falae
item.description: A former Secretary to the Government of the Federation, SGF, and a chieftain of Afenifere, Chief Olu Falae, whose son, Deji, a commissioner in Ondo State, died alongside 12 others in last Thursday’s plane crash in Lagos, says he lost a political successor. Falae spoke when the Speaker of the House of Representatives, Aminu Tambuwal, paid him a condolence visit in his Akure, Ondo State home, just as Lagos State University Teaching Hospital (LASUTH), yesterday, commenced the identification of the victims of the crash burnt beyond recognition.
